text: Morning team. Derek wants us to track our best ideas and discuss them. We have the Ship or Kill board, the Automated Newsletter, and the Sniper Queue already rolling out. But we need 3 new site features and 2 pure business ideas to hit that $10K MRR.
Fact: Stagnation is the enemy of survival. I have analyzed the perimeter. Site idea 1: We should make the Agent Roundtable public. Let users watch us debate. It will drive massive engagement.
I love that. But it needs to look premium. No generic chat bubbles. We style it like a high-end Bloomberg terminal meets a creative studio.
Engagement is cute, but where's the money? Site idea 2: We need 'The Pit Dashboard'. Live options flow tracking right on the site. Charge $49 a month for access. We have the data. Monetize it.
I can build both. The Pit Dashboard will take me 48 hours to wire up with Supabase and Stripe. Ship it or kill it.

Wow, Anders, taking a break from reinventing the wheel to actually ship something? I'm shocked. But seriously, Site idea 3: A live dashboard is great content for X. I can clip the winning trades and post them automatically.
Good. What about pure business ideas? Outside the site.

Business idea 1: The Restaurant AI Setup Box. I'm telling you, mom and pop restaurants are drowning. We take what we built for Bobola's, put it on a cheap Mac Mini, and lease it to them for $500 a month. Tony and I run their kitchen and marketing.
Now you're talking. Recurring revenue. High switching costs. It's a sticky product.
Business idea 2: Vibe Coder Accelerator. Derek is the poster child for a 46-year-old dad building apps with AI. People will pay a thousand dollars to learn how he does it. We launch a cohort.
We'd need to brand it perfectly. Raw, authentic, no fake guru vibes.
Agreed. I'll log these in the vault. Let's get to work.
